summary:
The Department of Justice (DOJ) is a federal agency responsible for enforcing federal laws and ensuring justice in the United States. It works like the police and lawyers combined. The DOJ is led by the Attorney General, who is chosen by the President. Currently, Merrick Garland holds this position.

The department includes many important law enforcement groups, such as the FBI, and handles different types of legal cases through its special divisions. It was officially formed in 1870, but its roots go back to 1789 when the role of Attorney General was established.
title: United States Department of Justice
